“The NPR decision on Trident low-yield capability was recommended by the Obama administration’s Defense Science Board in December 2016. It plugs a major hole in our current deterrent capability at virtually no cost.” - Dr. Mark Schneider, Natl. Inst. for Public Policy, Mar. 2018

Answer from Gen. Scaparrotti: “[T]he supplemental weapon systems that are a part of NPR are required. What it does is it ensures that we can be confident in a response across any scenario that that might be -- that might be projected. So I do believe we -- we need those systems.”

Question from @RepGaramendi “[D]o you need a new low-yield nuclear weapon to deter Russia?”   

Cont...

These capabilities are necessary to enhance the flexibility & responsiveness of our nuclear forces to ensure potential adversaries understand they cannot achieve their objectives through force and there is no benefit in the use of nuclear weapons—in any scenario.- Gen. John Hyten

The NPR directs near-term fielding of a low-yield SLBM capability, and in the longer term, pursuit of a modern nuclear-armed sea-launched cruise missile (SLCM).”  - General John Hyten, Commander of US Strategic Command

Low-yield debate: “We require a mix of yields & improved platforms to credibly deter the threats of the near future...
